DOC.brief_title: Supraphysiologic Insulin Improve Outcomes After Surgical Treatment Unruptured Cerebral Aneurysms
DOC.detailed_description: PREOPERATIVE NEUROPSYCHIATRIC & NEUROLOGIC TESTING Up thirty day schedule elective surgical repair intracranial aneurysm , patient undergo neuropsychological examination neuropsychologist psychometrician assessment neurologic status research nurse neurosurgical attending Department Neurological Surgery . The battery neuropsychological test include follow : - Benton Visual Retention Test - Controlled Oral Word Association - Rey-Osterrieth Complex Figure Copy - Grooved Pegboard - Trial Making Test - Hopkins Verbal Learning Test The assessment neurologic status time administer assessment follow : - Glasgow Outcome Scale ( 2 minute ) - Modified Rankin Disability Scale ( 5 minute ) - NIH Stroke Scale ( 2 minute ) ANESTHETIC MANAGEMENT Because possible effect various anesthetic agent immune function ( vitro vivo ) , patient undergo standardize anesthetic : 1 . Premedication 0— 0.03 mg/kg midazolam 2 . Induction anesthesia 0.05—0.5 mcg/kg/min remifentanil , 1—2 mg/kg propofol , 0.6—1.2 mg/kg rocuronium 3 . Maintenance 0.5—0.7 MAC desflurane 0.05-1.0 mcg/kg/min remifentanil rocuronium 0.1-0.2 mg/kg maintain adequate neuromuscular blockade . FIO2 = 1.0±0.1 4 . Maintenance core temperature 36.0±0.5°C 5 . Propofol 50-200 mcg/kg/min produce EEG burst suppression ratio 0.7—0.8 immediately temporary occlusion feed artery proximal intracranial aneurysm ( increase length time focal ischemia tolerate ) 6 . 2 mcg/kg fentanyl upon placement last dural stitch 7. discontinuation desflurane remifentanil upon removal head Mayfield head fixation 8 . Postoperative analgesia 0.2 mg dilaudid every 15 minute , PRN 9 . Antiemetic rescue 4 mg odansetron ( standard prophylaxis ) Additional standard care & standardized therapeutics/medications follow : 1 . Dexamethasone 10 mg tracheal intubation follow 4 mg every 4 hour 48 hour 2 . Mannitol 0.5—1 g/kg completion positioning , request surgeon 3 . Maintenance intravenous fluid ( `` 4-2-1 '' rule ) 0.9 % NaCl 20 mL/kg 4 . Replacement blood loss 6 % Hetastarch ( 1 mL : 1 mL ) 1000 mL follow 5 % Albumin ( 1 mL : 1mL ) 2500 mL 5 . Nicardipine ( 5-15 mg/hr ) ± Labetolol ( 5-50 mg ) keep systolic blood pressure ≤ 140 mmHg 6 . Phenylephrine ( 10-100 mcg/min ) titrate keep systolic blood pressure ≥ 90 mmHg 7 . Glycopyrollate ( 0.2 mg every 5 minute ) titrate keep heart rate > 50 beat per minute RANDOMIZATION On day surgery , confirm entry study ( i.e. , confirmation research consent confirmation completion preoperative neuropsychiatric neurologic test ) , patient randomly assign specific protocol—Supraphysiologic Insulin vs. Normal Insulin ( Appendix 1 ) . Randomization perform block 10 use computer generate random number assignment ( odd number = Supraphysiologic Insulin even number = Normal Insulin ) MAINTENANCE OF EUGLYCEMIA Intraoperative blood glucose level maintain target range 80—110 mg/dL ( euglycemia ) use randomly assign protocol , outline Appendix 1 . Blood glucose level , insulin bolus infusion rate , dextrose infusion rate record Intraoperative Insulin & Glucose data sheet ( Appendix 2 ) . Postoperative blood glucose level maintain target range ( 80-110 mg/dL ) use standard intensive care unit protocol ( Appendix 3 ) . PERIOPERATIVE SYSTEMIC INFLAMMATORY RESPONSE Blood sample serum protein analysis take patient follow time : 1 . With placement arterial line ( baseline ) 2 . Every 4 hour surgical incision 12 hour 3 . 24 48 hour surgical incision When possible , blood sample take arterial line place routinely perioperative care . One-half ( approximately 1/2 ) tablespoon ( 7 mL ) blood take plasma protein analysis sample time—a total 6 sample ( approximately 3 tablespoon 42 mL blood ) collect first 48 hour . POSTOPERATIVE NEUROPSYCHIATRIC & NEUROLOGIC TESTING Seven day ( discharge hospital ) ninety day ( ± 14 day ) surgery , patient undergo battery neuropsychiatric neurologic test administer preoperatively . In addition , SF-36 questionnaire administer time assess patient ' sense functional ability . Twelve month ( ± 30 day ) surgery , patient interview neurosurgeon 's office telephone ass neurologic recovery ( use battery neurologic test administer preoperatively SF-36 ) .
DOC.criteria: Unruptured intracranial aneurysm Diabetes Pregnancy Age less 18 year Inability undergo preoperative neuropsychiatric neurologic functional testing
